block.runology.runicworkbench.notenoughe: The Runic Workbench does not have enough Runic Energy for this recipe!
block.runology.runicworkbench.dontknowho: You do not know how to create this recipe in the Runic Workbench
item.runology.research.previousentryneed: You have not unlocked the previous entries!
item.runology.research.conditionsnotcomp: You do not have the required conditions completed!
entity.runology.runicoverseer.dialogue1: <Runic Overseer> So... You came to me looking to leave this realm.
entity.runology.runicoverseer.dialogue2: <Runic Overseer> I'm afraid I can't let you leave...
entity.runology.runicoverseer.dialogue3: <Runic Overseer> Every Runologist eventually goes to harnessing instability.
entity.runology.runicoverseer.dialogue4: <Runic Overseer> It's the only way the shattering has made it across all of the realms it has...
entity.runology.runicoverseer.dialogue5: <Runic Overseer> A few realms have a strong natural barrier which allows for it to defend against the shattering, however, all natural barriers eventually fade away...
entity.runology.runicoverseer.dialogue6: <Runic Overseer> I once tried to harness it like you did, and now look at this realm...
entity.runology.runicoverseer.dialogue7: <Runic Overseer> Now, for me to protect the realm you call home, I will destroy you!
entity.runology.runicoverseer.interrupt: <Runic Overseer> I see... You don't care for what I say. Now, I will destroy you!
block.runology.mysteriousaltar.seemsneed: It seems like the perfect spot to fit some sort of totem, I should search around more
block.runology.runiccauldron.owner: This Runic Cauldron is owned by %1$s
block.runology.endertransporter.modeandt: Mode is %1$s and Transport Type is %2$s
book.runology.runologyguide.discover1: This powder seems to be infused with one of the 4 elements, maybe I can find more types?
book.runology.runologyguide.discover2: This powder seems to react to powder infused with other elements, maybe combining all 4 types with a book will result in something useful?
advancements.runology.runology.title: Runology
advancements.runology.shatter.title: What is this and how do I get rid of it?
advancements.runology.shatteredsoul.desc: Kill the Runic Overseer and obtain a Shattered Soul
book.runology.runologyguide.name: Runic Codex
book.runology.runologyguide.basics.name: Basics
book.runology.runologyguide.purity.name: Purity
book.runology.runologyguide.basics.runic: Some things need runic energy to create. The runic workbench will allow me to use the runic energy obtained by consuming runes to craft these recipes, and is activated by using a gauntlet on it. It can hold 1000 of each type of runic energy; however I feel like this form of magic doesn't come without a potentially destructive problem...
While these first few things have been easy to figure out, for some other stuff, I will need to use the Runic Analyzer to figure out how to make.
To use this, I must put my research into it, then complete all the tasks it gives me. Once I complete a research, I must then read it to discover something new.
book.runology.runologyguide.basics.baser: Fire, Earth, Air, and Water, the 4 base elements of this universe. If I capture them in a rune, then I can convert them to runic energy and harness their power.
book.runology.runologyguide.artifice.voi: Infusing glass with void runic energy and a little bit of dragon's breath seems to create a material that displays some sort of void, similar to what I have noticed with the end portals.
book.runology.runologyguide.artifice.enh: By mixing bone meal with earth powder and infusing it with nature runic energy, I can make better bone meal.
book.runology.runologyguide.basics.runet: It seems that given the right circumstances, a rune may transform into a secondary type. I have written all the rune transformations I know about, and how to cause them, on the following pages.
By throwing an Air Rune on the ground in the end, I can transform it into a Void Rune.
By striking a Fire Rune with lightning, I can transform it into a Energy Rune.
By throwing an Earth Rune on the ground and waiting for a plant to grow around it, I can transform it into a Nature Rune.
By throwing a Water Rune into powdered snow, I can transform it into a Ice Rune.
book.runology.runologyguide.purity.purit: The 4 base elements, when combined, can create true purity. With this purity, I can fight against anything impure.
Using a pinch of Purity Powder, I can purify arrows, making them able to fight the impure by being shot.

If a hole in reality were to ever appear, this will work fine for patching it. Purity Arrows also deal more damage towards impure mobs such as the undead. I have a feeling there may be more impurity in another realm close to mine though...
book.runology.runologyguide.runicmysteri: It seems a shatter has appeared. They appear to be a hole in the fabric of reality, creating a bridge to another realm. It seems much too unstable for me to go through it - maybe I can stabilize it somehow?

Shatters appear to spread some form of impurity. Most natural blocks turn into shatterstone, ores turn into mysterium ore, and logs twist into shatterwood, killing the leaves. Could there be something useful from all this?

If I am correct, by creating a gauntlet out of mysterium and empowering it with 8 mysterium cores, I can stabilize a shatter by overcharging it with the cores. Entering a stabilized shatter is likely a one way trip. I feel an incredible power from the other side; I may need to defeat that incredible power to return to my realm.
book.runology.runologyguide.purity.purif: By infusing rotten flesh with purity, I can purify it, allowing me to eat it without any side effects.
book.runology.runologyguide.runicmysteri: What... happened here? Everything is dead and corrupted! There doesnt seem to be any remaining natural barrier.... Was this the result of runic magic? Is my realm heading down this path? Whatever happened, I must figure it out to prevent it from happening to my realm!
Instability may have caused this.... These crystals seem to be made out of instability. They may be useful once I get back...
It seems that before whatever happened, these corrupted growths were plants. It is impossible to tell what they were before, but now...? They might be corrupted, but they seem edible.

So this is the source of that incredible power. I must be ready to fight for my life if I want to escape... I have the feeling this will not be easy... For me to summon the incredible power, I must use a mysterium totem on the altar, I believe I can find a place with one if I search around enough...
This totem has a fraction of that incredible power beaming into it, so little that I'm unable to see it, but just enough to detect a trace of it. Maybe I can replicate it.
It seems even after surviving the shattering, their soul was shattered, can nothing can survive the shattering unscathed?
This blade, it can slice open holes in reality. These shatters are weak, but stable, meaning I can go through them, but they will close on their own after a short time.
I have come up with a device that can detect the resonance of instability, allowing me to know roughly how much instability is in the area I'm in. In each segment, there is about 125 instability.
It seems that there is a mysterious force I have named "Instability". The effects from it become worse and happen more often as the amount of instability in the area increases.
book.runology.runologyguide.ancientdisco: It seems that echo shards emit constant echolocation without upsetting the warden. If I shape lenses out of them, I can see in the dark by looking through them.
The ancients once used this lantern to steal flames for their own use. Their design would steal the entire flame, but I can improve upon it, stealing the heat instead of the flame.
To use this, I must throw it into a form of fire and let it absorb the heat. I can release that heat over time in the form of a flame, setting everything around me on fire.

This blade was originally designed to be made out of the scales of a long-dead species of dragon. I may not be able to find those, however I can make a metal using dragons breath and copper which will work as a substitute. By using this weapon, I can create dragon breath to kill my enemies, though it will need to recharge after I finish using it.
book.runology.runologyguide.spellcasting: Unlike gauntlets, staffs can cast ranged spells but are unable to cast melee spells. Amethyst will work for a staff core, but I feel it's inferior....
Unlike staffs, gauntlets can cast melee spells but are unable to cast ranged spells. Copper will work for a gauntlet material, but I feel it's inferior....
Using the fiery energy of blaze powder and magma blocks, I can create a spell crystal to be cast using a wand which will fire a simple fireball.
With the coldness of a few kinds of ice, this spell will shoot out 15 ice shards which deal low damage.
Improving on my previous design by using Mysterium instead of Copper, I can create a better gauntlet. This gauntlet isn't just for casting spells, though.
Improving on my previous design by using Mysterium and Shattercrystal instead of Copper and Amethyst, I can create a better staff.
The Spell Table will allow me to charge my gauntlets and staffs as well as adding upgrades to them.
To cast a spell, I must have the required runic energy in my staff or gauntlet, and the correct spell crystal in my offhand.
Using Mysterium Ingots and Raw Mysterium, I can create a spell that will summon a totem which will grant resistance to all players nearby.
book.runology.runologyguide.artifice.run: I can make a cauldron capable of melting items down into a fluid to create new things. It can be emptied by using it while sneaking with an empty hand.
book.runology.runologyguide.artifice.end: By combining Copper and an Ender Pearl, I can create a device capable of transferring items or liquids through the air. Using it will switch its mode, and sneaking while doing this changes the transport mode. I can attune it to a specific color using dye; dyed ender transporters will only send between others of their color.
book.runology.runologyguide.artifice.bud: While I can't directly harvest budding amethyst without breaking it, I can use transmutation to entice regular amethyst blocks to bud, allowing me to grow amethyst anywhere I want.
book.runology.runologyguide.artifice.gha: Ghast tears can be annoying to get, luckily I can create ghast tears with liquid souls and a fire charge
book.runology.runologyguide.artifice.liq: By diffusing soul sand in water, I can filter the souls out to create a liquid filled with souls. Weirdly enough, there is no trace of the brown color soul sand has, only the souls seem to be visible.
book.runology.runologyguide.artifice.tra: While the brewing stand is unable to make true transmutative solution, the runic cauldron is able to make it easily by diffusing nether wart in water.
book.runology.runologyguide.artifice.hea: Using Liquid Souls, I can create heads and skulls from different mobs. This should be much easier than the usual methods of getting heads.
book.runology.runologyguide.artifice.pow: It seems that transmutative solution can transmue natural powders into their opposite type.
book.runology.runologyguide.artifice.bas: The similarities between some materials allow me to transform one material into another. I have managed to figure out a few basic transmutations.
book.runology.runologyguide.spellcasting: Using glowstone and lightning rods, I can conjure a ball of energy that zaps anything non-human that gets close to it. This spark will also give off light.
book.runology.condition.analyze.ln1: Click with paper in your inventory to get research
